teal.sim.collision

Class CylindricalWallCollisionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.sim.collision.CollisionController
      • teal.sim.collision.CylindricalWallCollisionController

  • public class CylindricalWallCollisionController
extends CollisionController
    Collision controller for cylindrically shaped objects. Defines how to resolve collisions with cylinders.

      • collisionStatus

        public int collisionStatus(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method should return the state of collision between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. The returned value should be an ORed int of the possible collision states (not colliding, colliding, interpenetrating, adhering, etc). The method is abstract, as the details of calculating these states depends on the types of CollisionControllers involved.
        Specified by:
        collisionStatus in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        an ORed int representing the collision state.

      • interpenetrates

        public boolean interpenetrates(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method should test whether this CollisionController interpenetrates with the one passed as an argument. Interpenetration is defined as an overlap of the colliding geometry outside the tolerance range for a successful collision. Interpenetration needs to be resolved in the collision tracking phase.
        Specified by:
        interpenetrates in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        do these CollisionControllers interpenetrate?

      • collides

        public boolean collides(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method should test whether this CollisionController collides with the one passed as an argument. Collision is defined as contact between two two geometries within the specified tolerance range.
        Specified by:
        collides in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        are these CollisionControllers colliding?

      • adheres

        public boolean adheres(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method should test whether this CollisionController is adhered to the one passed as an argument. Adherence is defined as resting contact between the two geometries, and is used to resolve collisions between objects that are in constant contact.
        Specified by:
        adheres in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController to test against.
        Returns:
        are these CollisionControllers adhered to one another?

      • resolveCollision

        public void resolveCollision(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        Provided a collision has occured, this method should resolve the collision between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. Resolution of a collision involves calculating reflected trajectories, impulses, etc., and depends completely on the geometry of the CollisionControllers involved.
        Specified by:
        resolveCollision in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController with which to resolve the collision.

      • resolveAdherence

        public void resolveAdherence(CollisionController x)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method should be used to resolve adherence between this CollisionController and the one passed as an argument. Adherence involves resting contact, and is thus resolved somewhat differently than a regular collision. The details of this resolution depend heavily on the geometry of the CollisionControllers involved.
        Specified by:
        resolveAdherence in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        x - the CollisionController with which to resolve adherence.

      • set

        public void set(CollisionController c)
        Description copied from class: CollisionController
        This method sets the properties of this CollisionController to match those of the one passed as an argument.
        Overrides:
        set in class CollisionController
        Parameters:
        c - the CollisionController whose properties (tolerance, elasticity, associated object) should be copied.
